mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mountflorence, James C.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Transmits manuscript relative to French Revolution; been circumstantial about Marquis Lafayette; it is thought the U.S. might interfere in his behalf or that the Executive might demand him as a citizen of the U.S.; will visit south of the Ohio and then return to Europe; should any application to Court of Berlin be necessary, will be happy to assist; will be in Richmond until the 15th.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Lafayette, Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert Du Motier, marquis de, 1757-1834
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1793 February 1, Norfolk, [Virginia] to Thomas Jefferson, n.p.
